challenges: Reconciling high ideals with practical reality
Overcoming a tendency towards judgment and negativity
Finding a balance between idealism and realism
Managing a tendency to compare themselves to others
Letting go of the need for perfection

guidelines: Embrace the phrase "I (or this) is good enough."
Remember that who you are is more important than what you do.
Learn to accept and make the most of whatever feelings arise.
Allow your vision of what's possible to inspire you while enjoying life in the present moment.
questions: In what way(s) could this moment, this situation, this challenge be perfect? (Or, at the very least, be a perfect part of my/our evolution?)
What are three small things you could do to bring a little more light into the world? Say a kind word? Offer thanks? Make an apology?
What would it be like if a voice from the heavens told you that you'd already accomplished everything you needed to, and could now approach the rest of your life as play? And why not?

advice: Engage in practices that promote full, relaxed breathing.
Adopt healthy habits and moderation in all things
negative: Prone to stress and tension, particularly in the chest area.
May experience asthma symptoms due to suppressed emotions and pressure to excel
positive: Often have a radiant, blue energy field that is attractive to others.
Seek out evidence-based, cutting-edge techniques for health and fitness.

opportunities: Inspiring others to reach their full potential
Creating beauty and harmony in the world
Bringing light and positivity to those around them
Becoming masters in their chosen fields

advice: Approach relationships with a sense of playfulness and enjoyment.
Focus on the journey rather than viewing the relationship as a project.
Learn to relax and let go of the need for control in intimate connections
negative: May view relationships as projects to be perfected.
Can be overly analytical and critical of their partners.
May struggle to let go and enjoy the experience of intimacy
positive: Set high standards that encourage growth in their partners.
Bring a depth of feeling and commitment to their relationships.
Create a loving and supportive environment for their loved ones.

advice: Recognize and embrace their inherent talents and worth.
Overcome the fear of self-promotion and market their skills effectively.
Find fulfillment in work that aligns with their values and ideals
negative: May struggle with self-esteem and undervalue their abilities.
Can be reluctant to promote themselves or their work.
May experience financial challenges due to fear of marketing and self-promotion
positive: Driven to achieve excellence in their chosen fields.
Possess a strong work ethic and a desire to make a positive contribution.
Can achieve great success when they learn to value and promote their skills.
